newsitem.title: UK: Pearson says may buy Institutional Investor.
newsitem.headline: Pearson says may buy Institutional Investor.

text.p: British publisher Pearson Plc said on Thursday it might be interested in buying U.S. group Institutional Investor.
"It is one of the things that we might be interested in buying," said a company spokeswoman.

The Express newspaper said that Pearson is the front runner in a contest to buy the U.S. publishing group. The winning bid could reach as much as $200 million with 30 potential buyers, the paper said.

Analysts said Thursday's 2-1/2p share price rise to 709p, bucking the market trend, was more a reflection of news earlier this week that Pearson may buy a stake in John Fairfax Holdings Ltd national business daily, The Australian Financial Review.
"They've got to look at all these things. They've said financial news is a major plank in the strategy," said one.
